hillbillies.model

Class World

  • java.lang.Object
    • hillbillies.model.World

  • public class World
extends java.lang.Object
    Class representing a world.
    Invariants:
  • The number of units must be less than or equal to MAX_UNITS.
  • The number of factions must be less than or equal to MAX_FACTIONS

    • Constructor Detail

      • World

        public World(int[][][] terrainTypes,
             TerrainChangeListener modelListener)
      throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
             InvalidCubeTypeException
        Creates a new world.
        Parameters:
        terrainTypes - An array of integers specifying the terrain types.
        modelListener - A listener for terrain changes.
        Postconditions:
      • The factions, units, logs and boulders are empty.
      • The getTerrain() function will return a newly created terrain using the supplied terrainTypes.
            this.getTerrain() == (new Terrain(this, terrainTypes, modelListener))
        • Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Throws if terrainTypes is null or modelListener is null.
        InvalidCubeTypeException - Throws if the cube id is not valid.

    • Method Detail

      • advanceTime

        public void advanceTime(double dt)
                 throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Updates the status of all objects in the world with the given dt.
        Parameters:
        dt - The passed time between the last call to advanceTime.
        Effect:
        Executes advanceTime() on all Units and GameObjects of the World.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the dt is less than 0.2 or smaller than 0.

      • getPathFinder

        @Basic
 @Immutable
public PathFinder<IntVector> getPathFinder()
        Returns the pathfinder of this world.

      • getTerrain

        @Basic
 @Immutable
public Terrain getTerrain()
        Returns the terrain of this world.

      • getAllWorkshops

        public java.util.stream.Stream<IntVector> getAllWorkshops()
        Returns a stream of all workshop positions.
        Returns:
        A stream of positions of all workshops in the world.
            result.allMatch(p -> this.getTerrain().getCubeType(p) == Terrain.Type.WORKSHOP)

      • addWorkshop

        public void addWorkshop(IntVector position)
        Adds a workshop to the world at the given position.
        Parameters:
        position - The position of the workshop to add.
        Postcondition:
        The workshop will be contained in the world.

      • getLogs

        public java.util.Set<Log> getLogs()
        Returns all the logs in the world.
        Returns:
        A set of all logs which exist in the world.

      • getBoulders

        public java.util.Set<Boulder> getBoulders()
        Returns all the boulders in the world.
        Returns:
        A set of all boulders which exist in the world.

      • addGameObject

        public void addGameObject(GameObject gameObject)
        Adds the given gameObject to the world at the given position.
        Parameters:
        gameObject - The gameObject.
        Postconditions:
      • The position of the gameObject is set to the given cube.
      • The world contains the gameObject and the cube at the given locations will contain the gameObject.

      • removeGameObject

        public void removeGameObject(GameObject object)
        Removes the given gameObject from the world.
        Parameters:
        object - The gameObject to be removed.
        Postcondition:
        The gameObject is removed from the world.
        Effect:
        The gameObject is removed from its cube.
            removeObjectFromCube(object)

      • dropChance

        public void dropChance(IntVector location,
                       Terrain.Type type)
                throws InvalidPositionException
        Drops an GameObject at the given position with a chance of DROP_CHANCE.
        Parameters:
        location - The location to drop.
        type - Determines the type of object to drop.
        Postcondition:
        If a drop occurs a boulder or log will be added at the given position.
        Throws:
        InvalidPositionException - If the given location is invalid.

      • consumeLog

        public void consumeLog(IntVector cubeLoc)
                throws InvalidPositionException
        Removes one Log from the cube at the given position.
        Parameters:
        cubeLoc - The position of the cube.
        Postcondition:
        If the cube at the given position has Logs, one log is removed.
        Throws:
        InvalidPositionException

      • consumeBoulder

        public void consumeBoulder(IntVector cubeLoc)
                    throws InvalidPositionException
        Removes one Boulder from the cube at the given position.
        Parameters:
        cubeLoc - The position of the cube.
        Postcondition:
        If the cube at the given position has Boulders, one boulder is removed.
        Throws:
        InvalidPositionException

      • getFactions

        @Basic
public java.util.Set<Faction> getFactions()
        Returns all the active factions of the world.

      • spawnUnit

        public Unit spawnUnit(boolean defaultBehaviour)
        Spawns an new unit.
        Parameters:
        defaultBehaviour - Determines whether or not the default behaviour of the unit will be enabled.
        Effect:
        The unit is added to the world
            this.addUnit(result)
        Returns:
        If the number of units exceeds MAX_UNITS then a dead unit is returned. Otherwise a new unit with a random position above a solid position with random attributes (see getRandomAttribute). The new unit will have its default behaviour activated depending on the defaultBehaviour argument.

      • addUnit

        public void addUnit(Unit unit)
             throws InvalidPositionException
        Adds an unit to the world.
        Parameters:
        unit - The unit to be added to the world.
        Postcondition:
        If the amount of active units exceeds MAX_UNITS, the function does nothing. If not, the unit will be assigned a faction. Either a new faction will be created for the unit if the number of active factions is less than MAX_FACTIONS or the unit is added to the faction with the least amount of units.
        Effect:
        The world of the unit is set to this world
            unit.setWorld(this)
        Throws:
        InvalidPositionException - If the given unit's position isn't valid.

      • getUnits

        public java.util.Set<Unit> getUnits()
        Returns a set of all the units in the world.
        Returns:
        A set which is the union of all units from all factions.

      • removeUnit

        public void removeUnit(Unit unit)
        Removes the given unit from the world.
        Parameters:
        unit - The unit to be removed.
        Postcondition:
        The unit is removed from its faction and if the faction is empty, the faction is removed from the world.
